benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/bundles - Retrieve a bundle by external key

covered: Valid Request: Happy path (TC01) verifies successful retrieval and content-type.
Empty Response: TC16 verifies behavior when no bundles exist (404 bundle not found).
Query Parameters: Comprehensive coverage of externalKey, includedDeleted (TC02, TC06), and audit levels (TC03, TC04, TC05), plus invalid parameter values (TC09, TC10, TC29).
Authorization: Unauthorized (TC11) and forbidden (TC12) scenarios included.
Error Scenarios / Service Errors: Service/unavailable and dependency failure scenarios are covered (TC13, TC28) and 404 for not found (TC08).
Security: Input validation/security tests exist for SQL injection (TC19) and XSS (TC20).

Edge cases & robustness: Concurrency (TC18), transient network recovery (TC21), very large dataset (TC27), duplicate keys (TC14), extreme lengths (TC24, TC25), non-ASCII keys (TC23), unsupported parameters ignored (TC15), partial/empty input (TC29), and response time (TC17).
Response content validation: Tests verifying deleted flag (TC02, TC06), presence/absence of audit fields (TC03-TC05), and required Bundle fields (TC30).
gaps: Pagination: No tests exercise pagination parameters (limit/offset/page) or behavior when results could be paginated. The guidelines call out pagination especially for large datasets.
Caching Behavior: No tests check caching-related headers (ETag, Last-Modified, Cache-Control) or conditional requests (If-None-Match / 304 handling).
Rate Limiting / Throttling: No tests cover rate limiting (multiple rapid requests causing 429 or throttling behavior).
Detailed HTTP 5xx coverage: While 503 is covered (TC13/TC28), there is no explicit test for unexpected server errors returning 500 and how they are surfaced.
Pagination combined with query params: No tests verify interaction of pagination with includedDeleted/audit filters (e.g., paginated deleted vs non-deleted results).
Response header validation beyond Content-Type: Only Content-Type is asserted (TC01). Other headers (Cache-Control, ETag, Date, Content-Length) are not checked.
Rate-limited retry/backoff behavior: Recovery strategies or client-backoff behavior under throttling are not covered.
recommendations: Add pagination tests: scenarios that provide/verify limit/offset or page parameters, check total counts, next/prev links (if applicable), and behavior when results span pages. Include large result-set paging (e.g., many bundles sharing the same externalKey) and combinations with includedDeleted and audit parameters.

Add caching tests: verify ETag/Last-Modified/Cache-Control headers, conditional GETs using If-None-Match/If-Modified-Since and correct 304 responses, and ensure sensitive data is not cached improperly.
Add rate limiting tests: simulate many rapid requests to verify 429 responses or other throttling behavior, and test recommended Retry-After header handling.
Add 500/Internal Server Error test: simulate unexpected server-side errors (e.g., unhandled exception) to verify consistent 500 responses and non-leakage of stack traces/details in the body.
Expand header validation: assert standard HTTP headers (Date, Content-Length semantics, CORS headers if applicable) in relevant scenarios.
Add tests combining pagination + filters: ensure includedDeleted/audit parameters behave correctly across paged results.
Add negative tests for malformed UTF-8 and binary input beyond %00 (TC26 covers one case) to ensure robustness of input parsing.
